moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Repurposing/01 Repurposing Normal/Repurposing Long Form Content

overview.quote: It's easier to chip away at marble to make a statue than to build one from tiny pieces.
overview.introText: Long-form content is a goldmine for short-form ideas. Learn how to distill YouTube videos, podcasts, and articles into engaging short-form videos without losing their essence.

keyTerms.definition: The process of extracting the most memorable and impactful elements from long-form content for short-form adaptation.
Using what naturally stays in your memory after consuming content as a guide for what's most engaging to viewers.
Adapting a YouTube video's thumbnail and title into effective hooks for short-form content.
The process of consuming content with purpose, seeking elements that can be repurposed for your own creation.

actionPlan: Watch a YouTube video at 2x speed without taking notes
Write what you remember - these are the key points
Transform the video's title into your verbal hook
Use thumbnail elements for your visual hook
Rewrite the core message in your natural speaking voice

mainContent.title: The Memory Method
mainContent.text: For one-to-one video conversion, watch the long-form content at 2x speed without taking notes. Later, write what you remember - these naturally memorable points will form the foundation of your short-form script.

summaryPoints: Your memory naturally filters the fluff
Focus on what genuinely interested you
Creates content that's all thrill, no kills
Results in your authentic take on the topic

mainContent.title: Multiple Videos Approach
mainContent.text: To extract multiple short-form videos from one long-form piece, pause whenever an interesting point is made. Note it briefly, then later revisit each note to develop separate scripts once the original wording has faded from memory.

summaryPoints: One YouTube video can yield 5-6 shorts
Wait before writing to avoid accidental copying
Do your own research to fill in details

mainContent.title: YouTube Packaging Transfer
mainContent.text: A YouTube video's title and thumbnail are essentially its hook. These elements have already been validated by viewers, so adapt them directly for your short-form hook rather than looking at how they started the actual video.

summaryPoints: Title often makes a great verbal hook
Thumbnail text can become your text hook
Thumbnail visual elements inspire visual hook
They've already done the hook testing for you

mainContent.title: Article Transformation
mainContent.text: When repurposing articles, strip away the journalistic style and sensationalize appropriately for short-form. Headlines become hooks, but be wary of copying the formal writing style that works in text but sounds unnatural spoken.

summaryPoints: Write how you'd speak, not how you'd write
Add personality where articles are formal

proTips.text: Double-check your final script against the original - our brains often accidentally reconstruct exact wording we thought we'd forgotten.
Never use ChatGPT to rewrite article content for short-form - it can't capture natural speaking patterns that platforms demand.

finalWords.emphasis: Your Memory Is Your Best Editor
finalWords.description: What naturally sticks with you is what will resonate with your audience.
